Profiting from the Exploding Energy ChangeWave Access your FREE copy online right now at aaspIDDaa AOL USERS copy paste the link above into your browser Trailervision bucks dotcom meltdown trendDSpoof Trailer Web site plans boffo season with overseas syndication deals with Yahoo and Television sa les in the UK and US TORONTO May PRNewswire via COMTEX Web entertainment portal Trailervisioncom is bucking the dotcom meltdown expanding and signing de als despite the tide of dotcom flameouts Theres always a market for kick ass entertainment no matter what the climate is said Trailervision president A lbert Nerenberg Were making more deals than ever Trailervisioncom an edgy web site which spoofs current movie trailers and creates previews for movies that should exist has just closed a deal wit h Yahoo Broadcast produced trailers for Dreamworks website and has license d a joint venture called TrailervisionItalia in Italy The company plans to us e the Italian syndication model in Germany Belgium and the UK where formal inter est has already been expressed Trailervision originated the idea of imaginary movie trailers The company s trailers are also being broadcast regularly on the Independent Film Channel IFC in the USA and the company has just sold ten of its trailers to UK television hit Out There on Channel Trailervision is also working with the soon to be launched Canadian Indepen dent Film Channel in running an innovative contest for new Canadian filmmakers The contest calls for filmmakers to submit their movie scripts trailers for th e three winning scripts will then be produced by Trailervision and broadcast on the IFC The Trailervision TopTen is now being featured at the popular website wwwbeercom and Trailervision has signed a deal with Media to showcase their new interactive editing technology Trailervision will be releasing a film titled Trailervision The Movie and has launched two other websites wwwzapavisioncom a spoof ad site and wwwpointavisioncom a site featurin g clickable video There is less cash flying around said Trailervision VicePresident Nick Sutcliffe but the flying money seems to be landing smarter these days C NN called Trailervisioncom an international cult phenomenon Trailervision is viewed regularly in over countries on the World Wide W eb SOURCE Trailervision CONTACT please contact Nick Sutcliffe at Contact or mail at Trailervisioncom C PR Newswire All rights reserved KEYWORD Ontario INDUSTRY KEYWORD ENT MLM TO EDIT YOUR EQUITY ALERTS To unsubscribe or edit your alerts visit to find out why aaspIDaa AOL USERS copy paste the link above into your browser Yahoo Internet Life Magazine Continues to Score Great Demos Reports MRI Spring Study NEW YORK May BUSINESS WIRE Yahoo Internet Life the largest consumer lifestyle magazine covering the Internet with million monthly readers continues to report stellar demographics according to the MRI Spring Study released May The Study reveals that the median household income for Yahoo Internet Life readers is now a increase from the MRI Spring Study The median age for Yahoo Internet Life readers is years old with the college educated audience rising to Their attraction as a target audience is also evidenced by the fact that are employed in professional or managerial positions In addition to the increase in household income readers individual earned income also rose by from the Spring Study results These MRI figures clearly show the power and influence of Yahoo Internet Life readers said Diane Silberstein publisher of the Ziff Davis Media publication Yahoo Internet Life leads in every Internet usage category measured by the MRI Spring Study Comparing this years results to those attained by Yahoo Internet Life in the MRI Spring Study the Study reveals more of Yahoo Internet Life readers are shopping online for personal items more of Yahoo Internet Life readers are using the Internet for business purchases Yahoo Internet Life excels in other online categories including travel planning as well as researching real estate automotive sales and employment options The magazine ranks among the top ten for Using the Internet daily Any Internet access Listening to the radio online About Yahoo Internet Life Yahoo Internet Life wwwyilcom is the worlds largest consumer lifestyle magazine covering the Internet The Ziff Davis Media publication has a licensing and promotion agreement with Yahoo Inc but remains an editorially independent magazine It is not owned by Yahoo Inc CONTACT Yahoo Your News Alert for TXNHpst DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDD As requested your News Alert for TXN follows from EquityAlertcom To editdiscontinue your alerts please refer to end of message PLEASE REVIEW THE NOTICE AND DISCLAIMER BELOW DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD DDDDDDDDDDDDDD Paid Advertisement Turn rising energy prices into gains in six months ChangeWave investors are getting techlike returns from a small group of little known energy stocks Nows your turn to join the party Discover more in the just released special report Profiting from the Exploding Energy ChangeWave Access your FREE copy online right now at aaspIDDaa AOL USERS copy paste the link above into your browser Texas Instruments HighPerformance mA Transmitter Targets Temperature And Bridge SensorsDSmart Programmable Device Reduces Manufa cturing Costs By Offering DigitallyControlled Adjustments TUCSON Ariz Jun PRNewswire via COMTEX Texas Instruments Incorporated NYSE TXN TI today announced a smart programmable mA currentloop transmitter from the companys BurrBrown product line designe d for temperature and bridge sensor applications as well as remote data acquisit ion weighing systems and industrial process control See scaapu The highperformance XTR allows for digital calibration of sensor and transmitter errors via a standard digital serial interface eliminating expensive potentiometers or circuit value changes Calibration settings can be stored in an inexpensive external EEPROM for easy retrieval during routine operation Digitallycontrolled adjustments dramatically reduce manufacturing costs an d allow companies to build a single sensor design to serve a wide range of ne eds Individual units can be stocked and later programmed and reprogrammed for a ny of hundreds of possible endcustomer specifications special temperature range s etc Sensors can also be reprogrammed in the field if necessary By allowing the user to digitally adjust the gain offset and linearity of the analog output the XTR eliminates the need for manual trimming of potentiometers and the costs associated with this process said John Brown strategic marketing engineer for TIs HighPerformance Linear products Furthermore among the very few similar ICs on the market the XTR prov ides more versatile multichannel input and excitation multiplexing The XTRs wide programmable gain amplifier PGA range allows full scal e inputs from to mV The allanalog signal path contains a builtin subregulator voltage reference input multiplexer autozeroed PGA dual programmable currentsources linearization circuit internal oscillator control logic and an output current amplifier Current sources directed through the multiplexer can be used to excite RTD temperature sensors pressure bridges or other types of transducers The XTRs uncommitted op amp can be used to convert current into a voltage or for fourwire RTD circuits Functionally a mA transmitter provides accurate transmission of analog signals from sensors used to monitor physical parameters in industrial processes such as temperature and pressure to remotely located measurement equipment The sensor signal is amplified linearized and transmitted in t he form of current with no power supply required at the transmitter site mA current loops are not affected by line resistance and are much more immune to electrical interference Available Today The XTR is available now and is packaged in an SSOP Suggested resale pricing is in piece quantities The device is specified for degrees Celsius to degrees Celsius temperature range Texas Instruments Incorporated is the world leader in digital signal proces sing and analog technologies the semiconductor engines of the Internet age The companys businesses also include sensors and controls and educational and productivity solutions TI is headquartered in Dallas Texas and has manufacturing or sales operations in more than countries Texas Instruments is traded on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol TXN More information is located on the World Wide Web at Please refer all reader inquiries to Texas Instruments Incorporated Semiconductor Group SC Literature Response Center PO Box Santa Clarita CA ext MAKE YOUR OPINION COUNT Click Here prnX SOURCE Texas Instruments Incorporated Semiconductor Group CONTACT Texas your News Alert for AMCC follows from EquityAlertcom AMCCS Mekong IC Enables EndtoEnd OC System Solutions for NextGen eration Intelligent Optical Network EquipmentDMekong Represents AMCCs La test Generation of Oc Framer Technology With Integrated Features Target ed Specifically for the Optical Networking and DWDM Equipment Markets SAN DIEGO Jun BUSINESS WIRE Applied Micro Circuits Corp AMCC NasdaqAMCC today announced the availability of the Mekong S the industrys first highly integrated OC SONETSDH framing and pointer pro cessor device with onchip features critical for next generation optical ne tworking equipment Mekong is a multifeature integrated circuit enabling customers to collapse multiple functions down to one chip including aggre gation pointer processing and grooming functions Mekong is complemented b y AMCCs bestinclass CMOS SerializersDeserializers SERDES Forward Err or Correction FEC devices and switch fabric devices to provide an endto end chip set solution See figure that meets the power cost and space requirements of new intelligent optical networking equipment Mekongs a bility to remap section and line overhead or transparently passthru all T OH Transport Overhead bytes Standard and Reserved bytes with pointer p rocessing enabled on incoming SONETSDH signals enables intelligent optica l networking equipment to provide performance monitoring and support switch ingrouting decisions on incoming fibers This can all be done while provid ing full transparent processing of client interfaces over private DWDM netw orks and public networks said Mark Donovan AMCCs Mekong senior product marketing manager By designing the device to interface seamlessly with AM CCs popular OC transceiver and OC SERDES and G digital wrapperFE C solutions were further contributing to the companys overall system sol ution approach and reducing our customers timetomarket Mekong also s upports a variety of line interfaces for reducing system and board design r equirements For OC interfaces Mekong supports bit wide Mbitss in terfaces to enable seamless connections to AMCCs S SERDES device For OC applications Mekong provides bit Mbitss interfaces for sea mless connections to AMCCs bit S SERDES devices Mekongs OC interfaces are also designed for direct connection to AMCCs G digital w rapperFEC Hudson device Mekong is AMCCs next generation framerpointer processor device that enables the aggregation of four OCs into a larger OC signal or if used in conjunction with AMCCs Danube framerpointer processor device the aggregation of up to sixtyfour OCs sixteen OC s or logical combinations of OC OC and OC asynchronous interfaces into a larger OC signal See figures and Mekong provides standard SONETSDH pointer processing and in addition can transparently remap th e incoming OC and OC signals TOH across time domains and into the ou tgoing higher rate signal Mekong also supports a passthru mode where all TOH bytes Standard and Reserved bytes can be passed through Mekong with pointer processing enabled to enable full transparency across time domain s As a result when AMCCs Danube is used in conjunction with Mekong opti cal networking equipment vendors can offer service providers full transpare ncy from OC to OC rates Mekong can also perform the same functions i n an OCtoOC mode Enabled by the devices two APS ports Mekong provides protection switching and redundancy in both the multiplex and dem ultiplex directions and incorporates nonintrusive TOH monitoring for all i nputs The singlechip device features two builtin hitless Time Slot Inter change switches TSIs to provide STS level traffic grooming crossconn ection and adddrop applications When used in conjunctions with AMCCs re cently announced Zambezi an G STS level switch fabric device the Meko ngZambezi solution can serve as the first and Nth stage switch elements in a Nstage Clos switch fabric architecture See figure Mekong also offe rs a provisional pointer processor bypass mode for STStoSTS opera tion throughtiming both a full framer bypass no frame regeneration as well as a pointer processor bypass frame regeneration enabled are also p rovided Mekong also supports large deksew buffers in the multiplex directi on for STSc inverse multiplexing applications A highspeed microproces sor interface is provided for configuration and monitoring Mekong also sup ports POH BJGC monitoring Full TOH drop and insert ports and robu st alarm monitoring functions to provide the highest in OC SONETSDH in tegration and functionality for optical and DWDM equipment Mekongs fea turerich architecture and flexibility allows for multiple use in DWDM Met ro DWDM digital crossconnects multiservice access switches and core swi tch platforms said Neal Neslusan AMCCs marketing director of transport products It is well suited for OpticalElectricalOptical OEO switching applications where grooming wavelengths from the optical network and suppo rting electrical SONETSDH signal switching is required Pricing and Ava ilability The Mekong S is scheduled for sampling to development par tners in August with volume production scheduled for Q Packaged in a CBGA the device is priced at in volume quantities About A MCC AMCC designs develops manufactures and markets highperformance hi ghbandwidth silicon solutions for the worlds optical networks AMCC utili zes a combination of highfrequency analog mixedsignal and digital design expertise coupled with systemlevel knowledge and multiple silicon process technologies to offer integrated circuit products that enable the transpor t of voice and data over fiber optic networks The companys system solutio n portfolio includes PMD PHY framermapper network processor traffic ma nagement and switch fabric devices that address the highperformance needs of the evolving intelligent optical network AMCCs corporate headquarters and wafer fabrication facilities are located in San Diego Sales and engine ering offices your News Alert for AMCC follows from EquityAlertcom AMCC Develops Zambezi Offering STS CrossConnect Solution for Line Card Operations Up to GbsDDesigned to Interface Seamlessly With the Mekong and S Zambezi Completes AMCCs Comprehensive Digital CrossConnect S olution SAN DIEGO Jun BUSINESS WIRE Applied Micro Circuits Corp AMCC NASDAQAMCC Monday announced Zambezi S an STS cross connect grooming fabric designed for line card use Targeted for adddro p MUX systems digital crossconnects and multiservice switches this devi ce is optimized to enable Gbs Gbs and Gbs line cards to be built with an integrated first and last or Nth stage grooming fabric This sol ution is capable of switching from the STS level up to and including STS c traffic including arbitrarily concatenated traffic Zambezis single stage nonblocking switch architecture easily enables broadcast and mult icast configurations In addition the device offers an industryleading lo w power dissipation of W typical Dual x Gbs logicalpartit ioning of the internal switch fabric and dualcasted IO interfaces allow a single element to be used as the st and Nth stages of a larger multistag e CLOS switch Zambezi is unique in offering dualcasted IOs allowing fo r seamless switching between the redundant corestage switch elements Sixt een IO ports can be dualcasted allowing this device to directly drive and monitor redundant corestage switch elements Zambezi can also be used st andalone or as the core stage element in a multistage fabric as a x GbS fully nonblocking switch Zambezi is an extension of our STS switching capability previously demonstrated in our devices such as D anube and Missouri said Neal Neslusan director of marketing at AMCC Th is is the first device which can be coupled with our next generation pointe r processors for capability of supporting traffic up to OCc The cro ssconnect offers the capability to configure all of the IOs to either Mbs or Gbs on a per IO basis Many of the pointer processors availabl e today that may interface to a device such as Zambezi do not offer Gb s IOs Zambezis dualrate IO capabilities support a direct interface to t hese pointer processor chips This capability includes support of a direct interface to AMCCs recently announced Mekong device Customers may choose to use Zambezi in conjunction with Mekong and S for complete port densi ty utilization of the Zambezi Pricing and Availability Zambezi S is offered in a pin PBGA package and priced at in volume quanti ties It is scheduled for sampling in October and volume production Q of About AMCC AMCC designs develops manufactures and markets h ighperformance highbandwidth silicon solutions for the worlds optical n etworks AMCC utilizes a combination of highfrequency analog mixedsignal and digital design expertise coupled with systemlevel knowledge and multi ple silicon process technologies to offer integrated circuit products that enable the transport of voice and data over fiber optic networks The compa nys system solution portfolio includes PMD PHY framermapper network pr ocessor traffic management and switch fabric devices that address the high performance needs of the evolving intelligent optical network AMCCs co rporate headquarters and wafer fabrication facilities are located in San Di ego Sales and engineering offices are located throughout the world Forw your News Alert for AMCC follows from EquityAlertcom AMCC Delivers GBPS Digital Wrapper Backplane SerializerDeserializer For SONETSDH Transport and Very Short Reach OC Applications SAN DIEG O Jun BUSINESS WIRE The Verrazano Offers IndustryLeading Jit ter Generation and Provides a Percent Savings in System Bandwidth Exten ding the Life of Existing Backplane Designs Applied Micro Circuits Corp AMCC NasdaqAMCC today announced the Verrazano S the industrys first Gbps Digital Wrapper serializerdeserializer SERDES supporting SONETSDH transport and Very Short Reach VSR OC and OC transponder applications utilizing four Gbps links The Verrazano facilit ates the development of SONETSDH compliant serial backplanes saving syste m developers up to percent of a systems total bandwidth that would othe rwise be lost with BB encoding schemes Running PRBS data on all c hannels the device features an ultralow transmit jitter generation of picoseconds peaktopeak typical and provides outstanding eye diagram cha racteristics with a percent eye opening allowing for increased reach con nections at ultra low error rates See figure System developers bene fit from the Verrazanos SONETSDH compliance and compatibility with AMCCs industryleading Mekong and Zambezi framing and switching devices By inte rfacing with AMCCs Hudson Digital Wrapper device the Verrazano provides t he only complete solution for a midplane based Digital Wrapper design Se e figure Very Short Reach OC applications utilize the Verrazanos c ompatibility with AMCCs S and S parallel fiber components This ma kes the companys VSR solution ideal for system developers needing plugnp lay VSR links up to meters for racktorack and chassistochassis inte rconnections as well as boardtoboard optical backplane connectivity found in large terabit systems The Verrazano is the industrys first Gbps Digital Wrapper SERDES supporting the ITU G standard while combining e xcellent jitter generation specifications with improved bandwidth efficienc y said Jon Siann director of marketing at AMCC By delivering complete and intelligent connectivity devices to our customers AMCC demonstrates it s commitment to providing total system solutions for the next generation of optical networks and the terabit connectivity market Manufactured in l ow cost CMOS technology the device features a power consumption of W t ypical and runs from V and V power supplies The Verrazano supports FEC encoded and nonFEC encoded Digital Wrapper frames and provides Optica l Channel Overhead insert and drop and Digital Wrapper BIP monitoring for improved signal integrity Performance monitoring features including SONET SDH B and Digital Wrapper BIP monitoring Out Of Frame OOF Lock Dete ct and FIFO OverUnderflow provide link integrity monitoring in conjunction with signal integrity enhancement features which include differential CML highspeed IO onchip terminations programmable output swing redundant output drivers with individual squelch control and passive equalization a ll of which extend the life of existing lowcost backplane designs TDM t ransport systems can upgrade existing backplanes from OC rates to OC rates across the backplane by utilizing the signal integrity and link monit oring The device also supports OCc inverse muxing with full transparen cy allowing DWDM network operators to maintain proprietary inband messagin g Pricing and Availability The Verrazano S is currently sampling to development partners with volume production scheduled for Q Packa ged in a pin FCPBGA the device is priced at in volume quantities About AMCC AMCC designs develops manufactures and markets highperfo rmance highbandwidth silicon solutions for the worlds optical networks AMCC utilizes a combination of highfrequency analog mixedsignal and digi tal design expertise coupled with systemlevel knowledge and multiple silic on process technologies to offer integrated circuit products that enable th e transport of voice and data over fiber optic networks The companys syst em solution portfolio includes PMD PHY framermapper network processor traffic management and switch fabric devices that address the highperforma nce needs of the evolving intelligent optical network AMCCs corporate hea dquarters and wafer fabrication facilities are located in San Diego Sales and engineering offices are located your News Alert for TXN follows from EquityAlertcom TI Extends Wireless LAN Coverage Area By Percent With New IEEE b Chip and Reference Designs DALLAS Jun PRNewswire via COMTEX Answering market demands for better performing and more highly integrated IEEE b consumer products Texas Instruments Incorporated TI NYSE TXN today announced a new wireless LAN chip which will be available for u se in reference designs for PC card miniPCI and USB applications Increas ing the deployment of WiFiTM technology in broadband homes and offices TIs new chip increases WLAN coverage area by percent versus competitive solutions in real life environments the result of a percent linear rea ch improvement This reacharea improvement is vital for the growth of the home user market since it means consumers only need to purchase one access point or gateway to cover their entire home See scwir elessethernet The new chip the ACX is comprised of an integrated Media Access Controller MAC and baseband processor combined with onchip PCI CardBus and USB interfaces thus eliminating the need for external br idging components The chip supports both the CCK Complementary Code Keyin g and newer Packet Binary Convolutional CodeTM of the current IEEE b standard With PBCCTM modulation endtoend solutions using TIs ACX offer a coding gain advantage of dB over current CCKonly b solut ions allowing for the percent coverage area improvement Since it uti lizes an embedded microprocessor for implementing much of the MAC layer pro tocol the ACX is firmware upgradable which facilitates support of evol ving IEEE standards such as the forthcoming e quality of service an d i security enhancements The device is fully compatible with the IEEE b standard and also supports a Mbitsec high rate mode that do ubles the throughput over todays existing b networks By offering cost optimized reference designs and a new generation technology that can enable a sub retail price for better performing PC cards TIs ACX w ill help increase wireless LAN penetration in homes and offices said Alle n Nogee senior analyst at Cahners InStat Group The extended range achie vable by the ACX will also impact the growth of wireless networking in t he home environment since consumers will now be able to easily experience b roadband Internet sharing through a single access point which has not been always the case today Complete Reference Designs Speed Time to Market To help manufacturers achieve a faster time to market TI is offering thr ee reference designs using the ACX for PC Card miniPCI and USB applica tions The reference designs include a complete hardware development kit H DK which reduces engineering resource requirements by providing schematic s layout Gerber files and bill of material requirements These same refer ence designs also support the Mbitsec high rate extension Network dri ver interface specification NDIS drivers including configuration and site survey tools that are MicrosoftR WindowsR Hardware Quality Labs WHQL certified are also included TI expects to take each reference desig n through WECA certification of WiFi interoperability to further improve t imetomarket for customers To prepare for the fall arrival of Windows XP TI is also developing NDIS drivers required for this platform WHQL ce rtified Windows XP drivers for the ACX are scheduled to be available by Q The ACX was also designed with considerations for access point d evelopment Leveraging a bit PCICardBus or bit slave interface the ACX can easily connect to a network processor to provide a highly effect ive solution for access points TI has created an ACX driver development kit DDK offering an easy way for developers to create customized drivers often required for access point applications TI strongly believes that will reshape the Local Area Networking landscape said Marc Cetto general manager of TIs Home Networking Business Unit With our new ACX solution we will be able to drive wireless networking into more broadband homes offices and public places by offering a solution with extended reac h and range at the right price point for more consumers to adopt the techno logy We will continue adding technology enhancements while targeting syste m cost discontinuities for all our forthcoming wireless LAN products Av ailability ACX based reference designs are available today Production shipments of customers systems based upon the ACX are expected in Q About TI Broadband For OEMs developing broadband communications solu tions only TIs advanced signal processingbased silicon and software plat forms deliver the optimal performance lower power consumption and system level integration required to rapidly deploy differentiated next generation products for cable modems digital subscriber line xDSL modems integrat ed access devices IADs Voice over Internet Protocol VoIP gateways car rier infrastructure and home and office wireless networking Texas Instr uments Incorporated is the world leader in digital signal processing and an alog technologies the semiconductor engines of the Internet age The compa nys businesses also include materials and controls and educational and pr oductivity solutions TI is headquartered in Dallas Texas and has manufac turing or sales operations in more than countries Texas Instruments i s traded on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol TXN More informat ion is located on the World Wide Web at Trademarks WiFi is a trademark of the Wireless Ethernet Compatibility Alliance Pac ket Binary Convolutional Code and PBCC are trademarks of Texas Instruments Incorporated Microsoft and Windows are registered trademarks of Microsof t Corporation MAKE YOUR OPINION COUNT Click Here prnX SOURCE Texas Instruments your News Alert for BRCM follows from EquityAlertcom Nassda Releases Version of HSIM with Billion Transistor Capacity Na nometer FullChip Circuit Simulator Provides New Analysis and Device Suppor t SANTA CLARA Calif Jun BUSINESS WIRE Nassda Corp today announced version of HSIMTM the latest release of the electronic des ign automation industrys first hierarchical fullchip circuit simulator T argeted to designers of analog mixedsignal memory and systemonchip SO C integrated circuits HSIM provides detailed circuitlevel analysis of ti ming and power behavior and signal integrity effects This release deliver s new analysis and device support along with enhanced interoperability with other design tools I want to commend Nassda for producing such a produ ct for the memory and mixed signal industry said Puck Wong of Broadcom Co rp This is truly a significant and substantial development for mixedsign al circuit designers Nassdas support for Broadcom also has been outstandi ng We are extremely happy with HSIM HSIM version further enhances the accuracy performance device model support and nanometer analysis we offer to designers said Sang Wang CEO of Nassda Over customers are using our technology in their design flows This commercial success has con firmed our hierarchical approach to circuit analysis for analog mixedsign al memory and SOC designs This technology will become even more widely ad opted by the design community as they move into geometries at nm and bel ow HSIM Solves Critical Customer Issue HSIM solves the critical issue of analyzing circuit behavior while taking into account the electrical and parasitic effects of nanometer scale silicon Before the availability of HS IM design teams were unable to analyze these effects with a tool that had the speed accuracy and capacity that was needed In a recent benchmark H SIM verified a million transistor network processor in just over hour s on a bit workstation with Meg of RAM HSIMs ability to address cri tical verification issues is reflected in HSIMs dramatic rate of adoption by design teams throughout the world HSIM Technology Nassda created HSI M to perform fullchip circuit simulation and analysis with accuracy within of SPICE but at speeds three to four orders of magnitude faster than SPICE HSIM uses a patentpending hierarchical technology to deliver a capa city of over one billion transistors and is targeted to both pre and post layout analysis of circuits HSIM version further strengthens our l eadership in fullchip nanometer circuit simulation and analysis with unpre cedented performance and capacity stated Dr AnChang Deng President of Nassda HSIMs capability of annotating both layout parasitic and device g eometry information to a prelayout netlist is essential for efficient veri fication and optimization of design implementations HSIM enables first sil icon success New Device Models HSIM now supports simulation of JFETs found in communication designs using the same model found in SPICE simulat ors Another development for designers of highspeed systems is the ability to analyze signal integrity effects with a lossy transmission line model As well the latest MOS device model from UC Berkeley for nanometerscale devices BSIM is now supported The existing silicononinsulator SOI device model has been improved in accuracy by working closely with Nassdas customers With each new release HSIM continues to incorporate the latest developments from industry and academic research Enhanced Netlist Back Annotation HSIM version provides enhanced support for the backannotat ion of parasitic RC data in DSPF format and MOS device geometry informatio n including device size parasitics and resistivity Since they account for postlayout effects backannotation of DSPF and MOS device data is necess ary for accurate analysis of signal integrity and timing and power behavio r New Spectral Analysis With version HSIM now provides spectral an alysis by means of the fast Fourier transform FFT Performed interactivel y or after transient simulation HSIM enables frequency analysis of communi cation circuits This new capability provides industrystandard windowing f unctions for conditioning the analysis data as needed by designers Inter operability HSIM version delivers improved interoperability with other design tools by providing an application programming interface API for w orking with customers internal waveform viewers The new release also prov ides a user modeling interface UMI to integrate customerproprietary devi ce models Pricing and Availability HSIM Version is now available a nd is supported on workstations running Sun Solaris HPUX Microsoft Windo ws NT and Linux operating systems US prices start at Ab out Nassda Nassda Corporation Santa Clara California develops and marke ts fullchip nanometer circuit simulation and analysis solutions for advanc ed IC designs especially for analog memory and mixedsignal systemsona chip designs Nassdas HSIM product is the leading postlayout verification and analysis tool for achieving first silicon success and improving produc t quality and production yield Nassda has sales offices in Europe and Nort h America and is represented by distributors in Japan and the rest of Asia For more information about Nassda please check the companys website at Note to Editors HSIM is a trademark of Nassda Cor poration All other trademarks and registered trademarks are the property o f their owners CONTACT Nassda Corporation Graham Bell x assdacom or Lee Public Re lations Pam Wasserman URL Today s News On The Net Business your News Alert for TXN follows from EquityAlertcom Stellcom Demonstrates BluetoothTM Technology In Texas Instruments Booth at MonacoDWireless Integrator Showcasing Integrated Bluetooth Solution A t Bluetooth Congress SAN DIEGO and MONTE CARLO Monaco Jun PRNewswire via COMTEX Premier wireless integrator Stellcom Inc today announced that it is demonstrating an integrated Bluetooth solution in the Texas Instruments booth C at the international Bluetooth Congress J une at the Grimaldi Forum Monte Carlo Monaco Stellcom and Texas In struments have combined efforts to demonstrate an integrated Bluetooth solu tion with TIs PointtoMultipoint chipset solution The demonstration util izes Bluetooth technology and is built into Stellcoms handheld wireless ta blet running on MicrosoftR Windows CE Representatives from Stellcom and Texas Instruments will demonstrate the application in Texas Instrument s booth C located on the first level We are showcasing Stellcoms so lution because of its wireless engineering expertise with software and hard ware integration said Ari Rauch general manager Short Distance Wireless Texas Instruments Stellcom has demonstrated a wealth of experience with all facets of this project from developing the software protocol stack t o the hardware integration and OEM customer support Stellcom headquart ered in San Diego is a wireless systems integration firm committed to engi neering mobile workforce solutions that maximize ROI and increase worker pr oductivity Stellcom provides engineering expertise to leading Fortune companies in the areas of sales force automation field force automation extending eCRM applications and developing leading edge computing devices a nd appliances This is an excellent opportunity to work with an industry leader such as Texas Instruments to demonstrate how this leadingedge tech nology will revolutionize the way we communicate with our mobile devices said Tracy Trent Stellcom CEO and president Working in conjunction with TI to develop this demonstration strengthens our position as one of the pre mier wireless engineering firms for the implementation of mobile computing solutions Texas Instruments is an associate member of the Bluetooth SIG Texas Instruments PointtoMultipoint chipset solution addresses the nee ds of wireless personal area networking devices such as laptops PDAs and s mart phones The high performance pointtomultipoint chipset solution is comprised of the BSN baseband processor and the Bluetooth certified TRF transceiver working in host or hostless environments About Stellcom Stellcom Inc the premier wireless systems integration firm is committ ed to engineering mobile workforce solutions from the enterprise to the dev ice for Fortune companies and builders of Internet infrastructure Ste llcoms services and applications are delivered via its senior consulting engineering and project management teams utilizing defined Stellcom deliver y methodology By leveraging its reference platforms as well as strategic partners such as Microsoft BEA Systems Oracle and Sun Microsystems Stell com helps transform and enhance enterprise infrastructures build Internet based platforms and engineer wireless solutions all to manage mobile access to information Founded in the company is headquartered in San Diego with offices nationwide For more information about Stellcom
